newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down at new lows on options trades.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down at new lows on options trades.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended down at new lows in all but the July contract on options trades.

"RBC-DS bought 500 November 350 put options at $16 when the (futures) market was at $338 and that pushed everything down at the close," a trader said. July WCE futures crush margin rose to +7.15 Friday from +0.38 Thursday. "Japanese importers bought 400 August scale down late in the day, there were hedges, good growing weather and a feeling Chicago's going to open lower on Monday," another trader said. July-Aug spread from $14 to $13, July-Nov $20, Nov-Jan $4.
August lost $5.80 to $342.20 after a new low of $341.40.
RBC-DS sold July flax unchanged at $328.50, September rose $1.30 to $290.30 on late commercial demand. Volume was 150.
New lows were set in all western barley, feed wheat and oats contracts that traded.

July western barley lost $1.70 to $121 after setting a new low of $120 as commission houses covered shorts late, October lost $1.60 to $124 after setting a new low of $123.70. July Oct spread at $3. Volume 500.
July feed wheat fell $1 to the new low of $145 on commercial liquidation, October lost $2.20 to $149.80 after it set a new low of $149.30 on hedges, locals. July-Oct $5.
XCan bought 10 December oats down US$2.70 to the new low of US$104 from locals and commercials.
Commercials sold October and February feed peas up US$0.30 and US$0.80 respectively to US$166.80 and US$170. Volume 105.
(All values in Canadian dollars except oats, peas.)
